Title: the desperation emanation

Scene: The apartment. Leonard is stretched face down on the sofa.
Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard, Leonard.
Outside Howard’s house. Leonard rings bell.
The stairwell. Amy is sitting on the bottom step.
Leonard: All I’m saying is, if they took all the money they spent trying to make a decent Hulk movie, they could probably just make an actual Hulk.
So what’s going on with you two?
Right, right. So you’re still just texting and emailing? You don’t feel any need to hang out with her, you know, be in the same room?
Jealousy? What do I have to be jealous of?
Sheldon, I’m just not dating someone right now. I don’t need to go to a senior centre.
Fine. If I don’t meet someone soon, you can put me in a home.
You realize he’s just rubbing our noses in the fact that he has a girlfriend, and we don’t.
You have a girlfriend? How could you have a girlfriend? You can’t even speak to women.
Great. You have a girlfriend, Howard’s got a girlfriend, Sheldon’s got a girl…
What about you, Stuart? You have a girlfriend yet?
Why don’t you just break up with her?
Because I don’t need his girlfriend to set me up with one of her girlfriends. I’m perfectly capable of finding a girl on my own.
You’re saying I couldn’t get laid in a women’s prison with a handful of pardons.
What the hell? How long has she been here?
No, I’m not gonna try to pick up a woman in a bar.
Well, you know how you’re always saying that Amy is a girl who’s your friend, and not your girlfriend?
Look, she obviously wants to take your relationship to the next level.
Me? Well, how am I supposed to fix it?
Well, have you considered telling her how you feel?
All right, well, let me see if I can explain your situation using physics. What would you be if you were attached to another object by an inclined plane wrapped helically around an axis?
No, it’s just something I threw on.
Yeah. Turns out, they guard the iPods, but they don’t guard the shirts.
It was going well. I was showing this super hot girl how to boot up in Safe Mode. The manager got suspicious, and, well, long story short, they really do have a little jail in the mall.
I want to invoke the girlfriend pact, Howard.
No, I just, I want what you have. You know, I want a woman in my life.
To be clear, I meant like Bernadette, not your mother.
Well, I’m off to meet Bernadette’s friend. How do I look?
Ah, you’re going off the grid.
What if she just comes over?
You changed the address on the building? What about mail?
What do you want to do?
Thanks again for doing this, Bernadette.
Yeah. So, Bernadette tells me she knows you from self-defence classes?
Wow. Wouldn’t think there’d be that many.
Should be, it’s thirty dollars a pound.
Or maybe she’ll finally succeed in ripping my nuts off. There are still 93 ways she hasn’t tried yet. Look, Howard, I appreciate the effort, but this is, like, the worst date of my life.
I guess the difference is, I have some self-respect.
It’s relatively new. I just know that I’m not gonna spend time with someone I don’t like simply to have a girlfriend. I’m okay on my own.
Look, uh, Joy, it was nice to meet you, but…
Sheldon: That is apt and amusing. I think I shall share that with Amy Farrah Fowler. She’ll appreciate the witticism.
It’ll also help improve her initial impression of you.
Well, the status is as it always was. She’s a girl. She’s a friend. She is not my, please forgive me for doing this, girlfriend.

Leonard, you are my best friend. I’ve known you for seven years, and I can barely tolerate sitting on the couch with you. Imagine my attitude regarding prolonged physical proximity to Amy Farrah Fowler.
I sense judgment on your part.
May I suggest that your criticism is based on jealousy.
I have a functioning and satisfying relationship with a female. You have none.

Jealousy is an ugly green-eyed monster, not unlike the Hulk, who, by the way, also has a girlfriend. In this iteration, Jennifer Connelly, whom you may recall as the girlfriend of Russell Crowe in A Beautiful Mind, a feel-good romp if there ever was one.
Hu-u-urgh! Leonard not jealous.
You know, it just occurred to me, if there are an infinite number of parallel universes, in one of them, there’s probably a Sheldon who doesn’t believe parallel universes exist.
No point. It’s just one of the things that makes one of the mes chuckle. What makes you chuckle, Leonard?
Is it because of the conflict that arises from your desperate need to pair-bond with a woman, and the apparent collective decision of all womankind to deny you that opportunity?

You know, when my grandfather died, and Meemaw was alone, my mom arranged for her to visit a centre three times a week where she could socialize with other lonely people. It’s very nice. They discuss current events, play bridge, get a hot meal.
It is if you like bridge. Do you like bridge, Leonard?
Meemaw resisted at first, but now she loves it.
It’s not a home. It’s a senior centre.  We’d never put Meemaw in a home!
All right, I’ll bow to social pressure. Hey!
No, no, no, no!
Thank you.
Leonard? Are you sleeping?
Are you ill?
Are you still depressed because you’re alone, and no one loves you?
I want you to know that I’m genuinely concerned about your well-being.
You’re welcome. But it’s still no reason to have your feet in my spot.
Since we got home from the comic bookstore.
As per your suggestion, we’re hanging out. Quite frankly, I don’t see what all the hoopla’s about. Go on, Amy.
Did you know that, Leonard?
I did.

Wise decision. You see, Amy, success at a bar is based on classic male attributes such as height, strength, attractiveness, the ability to hold one’s liquor and throw darts, separately or together. Leonard has none of these attributes, right, Leonard?
Oh! Good point, Amy. Yeah, building on your premise, Leonard could frequent sushi bars, salad bars, oyster bars, the Apple Genius Bar, what are you doing?
He does it all the time. He’s a cornucopia of social awkwardness.
Let’s make that our word of the day.
Well, I have to void my bladder. It was nice spending this time with you.
Yes?
I see. Can I get back to you on that?
Good night. (Closing laptop, and running down stairs in panic) Leonard, Leonard, Leonard,
Amy Farrah Fowler has asked me to meet her mother.
What does that mean?
Uh-huh.
Wait. What?
I don’t want the next level. I like this level. Fix it for me!
Simple! You want a girlfriend, Amy wants to be someone’s girlfriend. Take her off my hands. I give you my blessing.
You’re right. It would never work. Amy finds you tedious.
Wait! What am I supposed to do?
Leonard, I’m a physicist, not a hippie.
Screwed.
Amy’s right. He is tedious.
As if one of the plants from Invasion of the Body Snatchers duplicated you in every way, only with an absurd amount of hair gel.
I’m removing my digital footprint from the Internet so Amy Farrah Fowler can’t find me and compel me to meet her mother.
Exactly.
Thank you. I’ve also sent Amy a relationship termination notice and changed my cell phone number and e-mail address.
She’ll get lost. We no longer live at 2311 Los Robles. We now live at 311 Los Robles.
Oh, no worries, I explained my predicament to our letter carrier. He was sympathetic. His exact words were, Got your back, Jack. Bitches be crazy.
Darn! She found me!
The only flaw in an otherwise perfect plan. Now, get my back, Jack.
Tell her I’m not here.
I don’t know. You’ll have to devise a scenario that plausibly explains my absence, keeping in mind that the key to a good lie lies in the details.
Way to go on the details.
Rats!
No misunderstanding. I’ve learned what that request actually means, and I don’t want to be joined to another object by an inclined plane wrapped helically around an axis.
So we’d be perpetrating a ruse?
And you haven’t fallen hopelessly in love with me?
Amy Farrah Fowler, that’s the most pragmatic thing anyone has ever said to me.
Of course. Would you like to join me for Chinese food?
My apologies. Good night, Amy.
I assure you I am quite real and I’m having regular intercourse with your daughter.
Oh, yes. We’re like wild animals in heat. It’s a wonder neither of us has been hurt.
Oh, yes, it’s time for me to make love to your daughter’s vagina.
Agreed. Amy, I find myself wondering if we should actually engage in coitus at least one time in our relationship. Bazinga. Bedtime. Please show yourself out.
Howard: Oh, hey. I hope you didn’t hear that.
What’s with the T-shirt? You working at the Apple store now?
I know all your shirts. That’s not one of them. You were pretending to work at the Genius Bar to pick up women, weren’t you?
Just FYI, don’t try to go back with a fake moustache. I mean, they may not really be geniuses, but they see right through that.
Yeah, I know what you mean.
Why the hell would you cross Ebola with the common cold?
Come on, just give her a chance. Maybe she’ll grow on you.
Seriously? I was once robbed by a pre-op transsexual I met on J-Date, and that didn’t even crack my top ten.
Raj: When I call him, his phone plays Brown Eyed Girl. Which, now that I think about it, is not so good.
Two words, deaf chick. It doesn’t matter if I can’t talk, because she can’t hear me.
Dude, why don’t you just invoke your girlfriend pact with Wolowitz?
Oh, Leonard, you remind me of the funny old story about a man who walks into a women’s correctional institution with a stack of paperwork that will allow the female convicts to go free.
Are you going to let me tell the story or not?
Howard (phone rings): Excuse me. That’s my girlfriend, Bernadette. I assigned her her own ringtone, Bernadette by The Four Tops. Hello, Bernadette.
Stuart: Oh, yeah. Yeah. I met her at Comic-Con, the one place in the world where saying I own a comic bookstore is an actual pickup line.
Not really. She’s horrible. When she wants to have sex, she puts on her plus-size Wonder Woman costume and shouts who wants to take a ride in my invisible plane?
‘Cause then I’d be alone, like you.
Amy: From a neurobiological standpoint, Leonard, you may be alone because your psychological state is causing an actual pheromone-based stink of desperation.
I understand that some people find mates in social gathering places such as bars or taverns. Have you tried a bar or tavern?
That’s not true of all bars. Juice bars, for example.
That was rude.
Cornucopia. What a mellifluous word.
Agreed. And we’ll use mellifluous tomorrow.
Wait. I have a request.
I’d like you to meet my mother.
Certainly. Good night.
All right. (Leaves)
Sheldon?
I believe a misunderstanding may have occurred when I asked you to meet my mother.
In what way are you screwed? All I want to do is present you as my boyfriend to my mother so she’ll be satisfied that I’m in a relationship.
Precisely.
Don’t be absurd. I find the notion of romantic love to be an unnecessary cultural construct that adds no value to human relationships.
I trust this clarification allows us to return to boy-slash-friend-slash-girl-slash-friend status.
Sheldon, please, you’re suffocating me.
Good night, Sheldon.
You wanted me to have a boyfriend, Mother. Well, here he is. Have to sign off now. My hunger for Sheldon is stirring in my loins.
Thank you, Sheldon, that went very well.
Mrs Wolowitz (off): You know I’m doing a bowel cleanse for my colonoscopy! I’m like an upside-down volcano here.
Holy Moses, how much liquid can be in one tukus?
Bernadette: Oh, I take pacts very seriously. One time at my lab, a petri dish of genetically modified super-virus went missing. That day we made a pinky swear never to admit we crossed Ebola with the common cold.
We never did. That would be a terrible, terrible thing.
Joy, this is Leonard. Leonard, this is Joy.
Girl (arriving): Hi. Sorry I’m late, I was at the gym. Spin class. Worked up quite a sweat.
Joy: Hi. You don’t look like a genius. Go ahead, say something smart.
Aah! Time’s up. Just kidding. First thing you need to know about me, I’m hilarious.
Yeah. Israeli Krav Maga. Lots of fun. Basically, a hundred different ways to rip a guy’s nuts off.
Hey, this is a date, right?
Excuse me, I have to go to the little girls’ room and take a wicked whiz.
Fair warning, I had the asparagus. My pee is gonna stink up the place.
Good news, I made lots of room for dessert.
Yeah, you, too. Hey, you got anything for next weekend? I need a date for my cousin’s wedding.
Yeah. And it’s an open bar, so I’ll probably be giving it away.
Sheldon (rhythmically, while walking dow: Proxima Centauri’s the nearest star. The celestial bodies that follow are Alpha Centauri A, Toli, Barnard’s Star, Wolf 359, Lalande 21185, Sirius A, Sirius B, BL-Ceti, UV-Ceti, Ross 154, Ross 248, Epsilon Eridani, Lac-9352, Ross 128, Procyon A, oh, darn, that’s wrong! (Heads back up stairs) EZ Aquarii A, EZ Aquarii B, EZ Aquarii C, Procyon A. Those are the stars that are nearest to me. Tra-la-la and fiddle-dee-dee. (Sees Amy standing in lobby) Oh, dear. They really do be crazy.
Joy (burping): This lobster’s good on the way down and the way up.
Sheldon (wearing a heavy coat and false: EZ Aquarii B, EZ Aquarii C, excuse me, madam.
Mrs Fowler (on webcam): It’s nice to meet you, too, Sheldon. I honestly didn’t believe Amy when she told me she had a boyfriend.

AllLines: All I’m saying is, if they took all the money they spent trying to make a decent Hulk movie, they could probably just make an actual Hulk.

You’re welcome. But it’s still no reason to have your feet in my spot.

I see. Can I get back to you on that?

Yeah, I know what you mean.

Oh, no worries, I explained my predicament to our letter carrier. He was sympathetic. His exact words were, Got your back, Jack. Bitches be crazy.
Leonard (there is a knock on the door)
The only flaw in an otherwise perfect plan. Now, get my back, Jack.

Thanks again for doing this, Bernadette.

We never did. That would be a terrible, terrible thing.

Joy, this is Leonard. Leonard, this is Joy.
Hi. You don’t look like a genius. Go ahead, say something smart.
